attributes.action: keep schools closed untill  ,then guarantee the safty of children and prove it.
attributes.additional_details:
stop using them as guinea pigs ,and  to proctect the schools by helping them and give them the equipment they need.
show the county that safty will always come first.
keep schools closed prove to us its safe show us the evidence ,and how you going to keep them safe.
attributes.background: keep schools closed untill you have a guarantee and a good plan in place .children safty should come first .15 to class how can they keep 2 meters apart as stated by government and stay aways from each other.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep schools closed until Covid 19 is no longer a threat: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316404

Halt the reopening of schools until the NEU's 5 tests are met: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321101

Delay the reopening of schools to September: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318206 

Reopen schools in August with shorter summer holidays for a transition period: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320459

Keep schools closed in the UK until an effective Cov-19 vaccine is available: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319292  

Delay opening of schools until Test Track and Trace for Covid 19 is working: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320891

Shut schools completely to stop putting teachers, TAs and pupils at risk: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308013

No prosecution for parents that remove child from school during a pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300399

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
